newsitem.title: COLOMBIA: Colombian stocks drift lower in thin trade.
newsitem.headline: Colombian stocks drift lower in thin trade.

text.p: Colombian stocks drifted slightly lower on Thursday in thin trading in Bogota and in a sluggish session in Medellin.

The Bogota IBB index dropped 0.06 percent to 852.24 on a 281.8 million peso volume, about $280,000. Meanwhile Medellin's IBOMED general price index edged down 0.15 percent to 13,363.36 on a 867 million peso volume.

"There were no buyers out there today. The markets were really slow because foreign investment funds stopped buying because it seems they have now consolidated their portfolios of Colombian shares," one Bogota trader said.
On the Bogota exchange, brewer Bavaria dropped 0.99 percent to 4,000 on volume of 40.1 million pesos. Banco de Bogota fell 0.67 percent to 5,860 on trading worth 33.6 million pesos.
Cement manufacturer Cementos Caribe rose 0.82 percent to 4,300, and Banco Ganadero ordinary shares edged up 0.39 percent to 254 each.

"Stocks are becoming more attractive because prices seem quite low at present. For that reason there's likely to be a slight upturn in coming weeks, but a lot will depend on what foreign funds are doing," the Bogota broker added.
In Medellin, shares worth 370 million pesos changed hands in insurance company Suramericana de Seguros, which finished unchanged at 18,500.
Brokers traded a total of 234 million pesos in cigarette maker Coltabaco, also steady at 3,000.
